attributes.action: take steps to ensure that the Royal Parks have regard to the Department of Health advice that people should take more exercise and reconsider the car parking arrangements in the Royal Deer Parks with a view to encouraging the widest use of the Parks, particularly during "off peak" times and give particular consideration to regular users of the Parks, for instance by offering a preferential season ticket scheme.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Royal Deer Parks in South West London, Richmond and Bushy,are widely used for sports and leisure activities. Users come from London and beyond. The Parks are poorly served by public transport and many users, of necessity, arrive by car. The available parking space has been reduced and now parking charges, applicable at all times, are proposed. This will penalise those who follow the Department of Health advice to visit their local parks and "move more". Those hardest hit will be the daily users, the pram pushers and dog walkers.
